alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Hampshire and northwestern Franklin Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Monroe to Middlefield. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Deerfield, Monroe, Montague, Northfield, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Ashfield, Colrain, Gill, Charlemont, Chesterfield, Worthington, Goshen, Cummington, Leyden, Heath and Plainfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
